channel.title: 3ds Max, vray, lights, and glass materials
channel.description:
Using 3ds max 2011, vray 1.50.SP4. Basically, vray lights or any other kind of lights do not shine whatsoever through my glass material.
[img]http://img222.imageshack.us/img222/9815/bedroom06.jpg[/img]
All the bulbs have vray lights inside, but no worky :( Here's the same vray light placed outside of the bulb and slightly away from the wall.
[img]http://img843.imageshack.us/img843/1281/bedroom05lighttesting09.jpg[/img]
So it works fine there.
Here's the glass material settings applied to the glass bit of the bulb, won't bother with light settings as I don't think they are relevant, as I have tried many different lights and combinations of light settings.
[img]http://img821.imageshack.us/img821/4823/glasso.jpg[/img]
The geometry on the glass bit is single sided with the material mapped onto the correct side.
Need any other info just ask. Any ideas? Kinda annoying me, wanna get this shizz finished. Cheers.
